Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_Bec
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on the way home to Australia. The location is in the CBD, just a 5 minute walk to Chinatown (Maxwell street food market is about 5 mins away), but it is a taxi/bus/MRT ride to most other destinations within Singapore. The hotel is very cool, from the 'Pod' reception desk (check out the acoustics in the pod), to the shower in the centre of the room. The reception waiting area is very functional and spacious. The room we had was not overly large, but for one night was more than fine. The staff were excellent from check in to check out, explaining how everything worked and offering to add additional devices to the complementary wifi. The breakfast was just passable, the scrambbled eggs were ordinary, but the buffet was ok. The bed that we had was excellent and the pillows were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Groovy, baby!”
Reviews.Author: terminalcase42
Reviews.Content: Came for a short staycation to celebrate my husband's birthday. Loved the decor of the hotel, which was groovy and quirky but not over-the-top. Definitely enjoyed our private jacuzzi, though the lounger was soaked from the rain the night before and therefore impossible to use. It would have been nice if there was some sort of shelter so that we could enjoy the private outdoor facilities yet be sheltered from the rain. Especially liked the lighting in the room, with interesting fixtures and different settings to create a range of moods.

Reviews.Title: “Internet in the room doesnt work and staff is hopeless”
Reviews.Author: R0ckSalt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here about three times before. The rooms are fine. The "shower in the middle of the floor" thing is a bit quirky but gets old after a while. I occupies the room and gives you no room to unpack or lay out your luggage. Up until now I have not needed to do any work in my room so I never used the wi-fi. Well, the wi-fi on the second floor gives you "five bars" of signal in the hallway and between zero and one bar at your desk. That's helpful. I complained to the front desk and both the manager and the young woman on duty were helpless. And hopeless. They kept saying they'd reset the wi-fi. As if that is going to do anything. They did, and it didn't. They offered me another room on the 2nd floor which was the same. Then the manager leaves for the day right in the middle of supposedly trying to help me, and the woman at the desk wouldn't call him. Then they found a room on the third floor which for whatever reason has five bars of signal which is great. But to be honest, the last thing I feel like doing is spending fifteen minutes packing my bags, shlepping them up to the next floor, and then getting re-settled in. So I declined. I stay in hotels about 100 nights a year, and to be fair, you get your share of sub-standard experiences. But I am so frustrated by this that it compelled me for the first time ever to write a tripadvisor review. So, my recommendation is that if you want wi-fi or reception staff with a clue, don't stay here. Or else insist on the third floor without paying more for it. (I have no idea if all the rooms on the 3rd floor are fine or not)

Reviews.Title: “A very nice,clean and quiet place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBun000
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days and extended for 3 more as a family (couple + 1 year old girl) and we were happy about the decision. The Thumbs Up: 1-Clean-it smells of green apple as soon as you walk in (can't see how though- we never saw a single candle,diffuser or anything of the sort to create a wonderful scent). 2-Tastefully Different- the decor is modern,clean and somewhat other world-ly.the reception gives a feel it's a spaceship about to take off.We love hanging out in the reception area. 3- Good sized room-We stayed in the 3rd floor and the space was enough for a small family. 4-Friendly Staff 5-Room Amenities-Molton Brown toiletries,an Essenza coffee maker in room and we love how you can control the lighting and the curtains with a flick of a button.Our baby enjoys watching it close and open. 6- Location-close to a lot of restaurants (walk towards Anson Road near the CBD area), a lot of eateries nearby.Orchard Road isn't very far either. Things they need to improve 1-upgrade the menu, as food choices are very limited.they taste good though. 2-the tv stations-hope you will include programs for kids.the channels we get are the basic Singapore ones plus few too grown up cable tv channels. 3-the room we were in had an outdoor veranda-problem was it was rainy half of the time and we don't wanna sit out because the lounges were sopping wet.maybe install a plexiglass roofing and a drainpipe? also the lounges were dusty.maybe changing them into waterproof ones would be less maintenance and would last longer as well.we really wanted to enjoy this veranda but too bad it was wet and half the time dusty.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, location, and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: KamandHema
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore as a stopover for a couple of days. I would recommend this hotel for everyone looking for a good value design hotel in an expensive city for hotels. The hotel room is very stylish, the rooms are spacious and very chic. The bathroom may not be to everyone's taste as you can see through to the room, but if you are a couple this shouldn't matter. The massive rain shower with good pressure and radio was lovely and the private terrace was a bonus. The bed was comfortable and spacious. The location was excellent 5 mins walk to the mrt and a couple of stops to all the main points of interest. Room contained nice mod cons including an iPod dock and mood lighting, also breakfast was great. Fabrika roof top bar is worth checking out, nice view at night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, perfect location, awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: jenandjuice
Reviews.Content: I love the decor, very custom and origional. I stayed in the suite with the jacuzzi and it was amazing. The shower was spacious with great water pressure, the bed was very comfortable, the staff was very pelasant and prompt, and the breakfast was delicious. Its walking distance to the MRT, shopping, and food...great location. I plan to visit Singapore again, and when I do, I will be back to Klapsons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, staff very nice”
Reviews.Author: Brandy T
Reviews.Content: Singapore is expensive and this place was good value for what it was. I'm not crazy about too trendy design but the room was lovely and balcony a big plus. I stayed in the suite without a jacuzzi as it rained the whole time I was there. The amenities are lovely and shower had great pressure. Bed very comfy. Breakfast was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Funky in an Austin Powers way”
Reviews.Author: chantal_dunbar
Reviews.Content: If you're in to singing in the shower thn the test tube shower units placed in the middle of guest rooms are ideal. You can strike a pose and check out your sudsy tunes in the floor to ceiling mirror while you're belting out a 60s song. Purple and orange velvet and plastic decor top it off...sounds ways weird and it is... But in a cool kind of way. I think I had a rutting Asin couple next door...or someone murdering a guinea pig...and the thin walls were an issue once it lost its funniness. The space pod reception area as freaky acoustics and the small restaurant is ok. A bit inconvenient in location. Isolated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: nurulj88
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent time staying at Klapsons hotel. The staff were friendly, attentive and accomodating to our requests. The design of the hotel is impressive. I stayed at the Klapsons Oasis Suite and i absolutely loved the jacuzzi. Wide range of channels was available on the television. The room was spacious and clean and the bed was comfotable. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Flexible and Excellent Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Joelle N
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with their hotel the moment I stepped into the lobby. The ambiance and style were fantastic. Their kind staff led me to my room, the oasis suite and the place is very clean and tidy. The picture of their room in the website is true to what I saw in the hotel. Overall, everything was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful local stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: j_wong11
Reviews.Content: Recently i had a stay at the oasis suite at Klapsons and i am really glad to have chosen this hotel. The lobby furniture and the room furniture was really unique, bright and lively. The service was excellent and the rooms were beautiful. The staff were also friendly and the service was impeccable. The bed was really comfortable. My friends and i actually missed the complimentary breakfast time, but the staff at the restaurant whipped up a simple yet delicious breakfast for us. It was really nice of them to do that for us!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Charmaine C
Reviews.Content: Good service and good location. Though most of the taxi drivers are not aware of this hotel, in fact, not difficult to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elodie E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few minutes away by taxi from the center and the hotel is really nice, the decoration is original which makes it way better. The staff is friendly and the amenities are good. There is a complimentary mini bar and free wifi which makes your stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel apart from annoying music”
Reviews.Author: ross h
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms (Amazing shoers, excellent staff, excellent room service, decent location. All slightly let down by the fact there was loud annoying music playing in the corridors that could be heard in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Funky fun hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Teddybear00
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a small but funky lobby with lots of personality. The reception desk is situated in an elevated dome in the middle. It echos when you speak so you feel like you're in a spaceship. We checked in at 11am to the Executive Room. It's a small hotel with only 2 floors of rooms. The room has a contemporary design with a open concept shower right in the middle. Not good if you're travelling with friends. More for couples. Nespresso machine and free minibar (2 soft drinks, 2 water, 1 beer and 1 orange juice) were nice touches. Loved the Molton Brown toiletries too. I believe the suites provide Chopard toiletries. We were there for a function and met the events manager, Dean, who was extremely professional and personable. We were too tired to try the breakfast, though it was included in the room rate. Only down side is the location, there's nothing around the hotel and the subway is not within walking distance. Taxis are relatively inexpensive so we'd still stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: adrianho12
Reviews.Content: Marvelous design with high quality furnishing. Service is top class! Breakfast is sumptuous. A kind of it's own. Two thumbs up!!Will definitely be back again and would recommend friends and associates for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely come back!!”
Reviews.Author: Nazliah A
Reviews.Content: It captivates both my husband & my eyes the moment we reached the lobby as the interior design is so unique, especially the reception booth. It WOW-ed us even more the moment the staff brought us to our room to show around. The Suite room was beyond our explaination. Its totally AWESOME!! We really love it! From the interior designs, the outdoor private jacuzzi, the relaxing area (balcony), the 101% comfy bed n pillows, the outstanding bathroom as well as the service, i'll give it 2 big thumbs up! Really enjoyed our honeymoon in this relaxed n clean hotel. Really leaves a great sweet memories staying here and willl defintely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced, average Hotel! - More Style than Substance!”
Reviews.Author: nabbas
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this is just an OK hotel. It could be so much better and a few things let this place down. On the whole it was a disappointing stay. However, I have weighed up the Pro's and Con's of this Hotel. Design wise, it is ultra-modern, and has a very impressive first impression as you walk into the Hotel lobby. Checking in was smooth and a porter took our bags to be delivered to the room. We were checking in early (8am) and were told that early check-in would normally be an extra night charge, however gladly this was offered complimentary to us. We were also given our passwords for the Internet. All good so far then? The rooms, at first impression are impressive. We stayed in the 'Executive' room which was the entry level grade of room. It was clean, modern of course, and yes we were faced with the very 'trendy' Open Shower concept. Odd at first, but actually had no problem with this since we were a couple. After first 'wow' factor and novelty factor wears off though, it becomes clear after 3 nights of stay that a lot of the rooms features are 'style over substance'. The side tables for example are too far away from the bed (which is btw extremely comfortable). It means reaching for your water or drink from the bed is a bit of a stretch! Also, the lighting system is electronic and has various 'settings' such as 'Cosy', 'Night-time', and 'Shower'. All very cool, but awkward and fiddly when you want greater control over the lighting. Same goes for the curtains, electronically controlled which means opening and shutting the blinds or curtains are a bit 'trial and error' as no instructions are given as to what button controls what. As I say, the bed was very comfortable, one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in, so plus points there. The Shower as mentioned was in the middle of the room in a glass semi-circle. This was actually quite cool I thought although a bit 'trendy for the sake of it' - It is a Boutique after all though, and 'Trendy for the Sake of it' is kind of a given at Boutique Hotels. The toilet, thankfully, is seperated by a door. However, it is in reality only a hinged sheet of toughened glass and is only partially frosted. This means, without being too vulgar, that you can hear pretty much everything from the bathroom. Despite my partner and I knowing each other very well, there are some spaces that should be somewhat sound-proofed and private - the toilet being one of them. On other plus points of the room, Free WiFi was fairly easy to setup and extremely fast once connected. A lack of a second plug socket on the desk though led to me having to unplug the wireless Phone in order to charge my Laptop/Mobile, again not ideal, and clear evidence that they have thought more about style than function. Service attitude, on the whole, was good. Polite and pleasant service staff who did tend to our needs very efficiently and with a smile. However, some things I felt we didn't need to, and shouldn't have had to ask for - On our final night for example, the night/bath gowns (although only thin silk types) had been removed from the room and not replaced. We did ask for them to bring some up and they did so very quickly but we shouldn't have needed to ask. As mentioned, they were only the thin, silk/synthetic types as opposed to full wool/cotton ones that a lot of hotels provide. These would have been a lot more cosy when relaxing in the room. On the services front, Room Service is only available until 10pm. This is a bizarre policy, as most hotels above 4 stars have 24 hour room service. If you want some food or even just a drink when returning home from Dinner, this is impossible on Sunday's as even the rooftop bar, Fabrika, was closed by 11:30pm on the Monday (it is meant to be open until Midnight but they decided to close early and lock the door!), much to the surprise of the Front Desk and much anger and annoyance from us as we found this to be extremely unheard of! Upon requesting, the service staff did kindly bring up to the room two glasses of wine upon request - at $15 SGD ($10 USD) each though these were not the cheapest of glasses of wine, although probably in line with Singapore prices. The bar was also closed completely the day before as it is always closed on Sunday's. Considering the Sunday was also Race Night of the Singapore F1, I think they missed a trick not opening as there would have been plenty of punters wanting further drinks post-race. Breakfast was ok, european, and again, could have been much better. The Western Hot food was good, and choice of eggs nice. However, the 'Scandinavian' breakfast was a little thin (small selection of fruit and small selection of Cereals does not qualify it to be a 'Scandinavian Breakfast was how my swedish partner described it). The bottom line with this hotel is that is largely style over substance, that with a small few changes, could be both.. So to sum up... PRO'S - Clean and Very Trendy Design - Good Service staff (helpful & Friendly) - iPod Dock in Room (in this day and age, a must for any decent modern hotel!) - Free Mini-Bar (although only 1 bottle of Beer, the rest juices and coke) - Nespresso Coffee Machine. But...the CONS/Improvements Needed .... - Poor Value for Money rooms - Fabrika Bar needs to open on Sunday's and for longer. If your opening hours state Midnight, then do not lock the door to customers at 11:30pm - Room Amenities could be better - namely Bath/Night Gowns, more Toiletry supply and improvements to 'practical' design within the room. - Room Service needs to be available for much much longer and 7 days a week. I shall not be returning to this hotel when I stay in Singapore again as I believe, for the room rate, I could stay at a different Boutique Hotel or even at one of the larger chains on the Marina. After 2 Years in operation, this Hotel should be much better than it is, and if it wants repeat customers, these changes will have to be made. Rating - Bordering on 3, probably 2.5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we shall return”
Reviews.Author: raymondgwee
Reviews.Content: In downtown Tajong Pagar. Walking distance to Chinatown and Lau Pat Sa. Not far from Marina Bay and Sentosa. About 7-10 mins walk to MRT. Only 17 rooms in the hotel. Opened for about 2 years. Very friendly and efficient staff, attend to customers every need. Most importantly in Singapore, they book the taxis for you and a comfort taxi will arrive within 3-5 minutes. The breakfast was included and fantastic coffee shop named Lucas. The omlette is a must try and offers a variety of choices for breakfast including salmon, sausage, bacon, scrambled eggs, fruits, cereals, bread and cakes. Fresh flowers placed at hotel every day. Reception counter and whole hotel is a modern cybel feel. Could listen to radio while taking shower and choose the colours of the lights. About 240 dollars singaporean for a room per day. Reasonable and valued for money. I have travelled the world and visited over 35 countries, this hotel is right up with the very best that I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, not-your-regular hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanieOctia
Reviews.Content: Klapsons is in the business area but because it has limited rooms, you'll find quiet and peace every time. I've stayed in the hotel twice early this year and I found the service at par with some hotels I've been to. Their wifi is fast, which is important for business travelers like me. The breakfast though is not as much compared to bigger hotels, which is understandable given that they only have few guests at any given time. The open shower concept often surprises people, but rooms and hallways are always clean. The nespresso machine and ipod dock are also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Another option for business travellers working in the Tanjong Pagar area”
Reviews.Author: meliacholy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night having won a contest, so had no expectations. Room was clean, cosy and comfortable but my only complaint is similar to the previous reviewer - the open concept shower area as I almost slipped a few times near the bed. Had dinner at the in-house restaurant, which had reasonably priced food (55 degrees veal was tender and nice, lobster risotto was undercooked and disappointing). Next morning, we got to breakfast 30 minutes to the end of buffet and found their selection limited to yoghurt and salad. Most of the foodstuff were finished and the staff did not intend to replenish. However, upon request, eggs and sausages were cooked to make up for the lackthereof. Spotted three hotel staff hussling together to read my feedback form after I walk out of the hotel, not sure if it reached the management. I will stay here again only if I have business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: S_von_Linde
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, apart from the fact that the shower is located within the sleeping room and it becomes quite wet immediately, so the wall covering is already wavy. The breakfast is mostly European and sufficient, the breakfast service staff was exceptional. They also offer WiFi for free, and the recommendations for restaurants, for shopping, for doing something in the sparse time were very helpful. Go there if you like modern hotels, don't go there if you rather like the classical ones.

Reviews.Title: “Nice haven in middle of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TeroThynell
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for one night, which is a shame. Very, if not extremely friendly service. Very clean and convenient room. We had our own secluded terrasse which was definately a big bonus. Very nice indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Inflexible Hotel compared to other hotels near this area”
Reviews.Author: Miwa_75
Reviews.Content: We booked a hotel for a meeting as this is nearer to the local office. However the meeting was cancelled off last minute and yet the hotel went ahead to deduct the night's cost without even informing my client. It was only later then they send an email to state they they took the liberty to deduct the money saying its hotel policy. And the problem is most hotels allowed cancellation within 48 hours and this particular hotel insisted on 72 hours! If you are looking for nearby hotels, go for friendly hotels like New Majestic and Wangz Hotel. At least they are not that inflexible in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel matched with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LeConcierge
Reviews.Content: Stayed at klapsons for two nights to attend a wedding. Impressive check in counter with smiling staff, scented lobby with colourful and uniquely designed furniture, I knew this would be a wonderful weekend stay. Oasis room was just right in size and had an outdoor terrace. Espresso machine, complimentary mini bar, although an extra bottle of beer would have been nice and Molton Brown amenities were touches. Aside from the fantastic design of the hotel, it was the staff who made my stay extra special from the bell staff to the waitstaff and duty manger. Smiles were abundant and assistance always offered. I definitely will be back at klapsons

Reviews.Title: “Better for leisure, not business”
Reviews.Author: myWei
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Klapsons for 3 nights on a business trip with a colleague. Overall, the rooms are quite comfortable - we had a nice big terrace with deck chairs. The only thing that was quite annoying is that the rooms are not very intuitively designed. The shower + sink area is located separately from the toilet but there is no door to shower/sink area which means that when someone is using the shower, the other person is confined to the living area. (Although this might not be the case for rooms with twin beds) Room service was fast enough and there's a cute sandwich stall off the lobby of the restaurant. Cabs were easy to come by as well. The staff were very helpful and FAST - did not have any problems getting WiFi passwords, as opposed to some hotels I have experienced. Generally quite a pleasant and efficient stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay at Klapsons.”
Reviews.Author: frozen_fire19
Reviews.Content: First, just to save your time reading this review, can I just say that if you're thinking of going to a chic 'design' hotel in Singapore you're better off at Quincy Hotel rather than Klapsons? My partner and I booked a weekend staycation at Klapsons, having previously stayed at Quincy and enjoyed it immensely, we thought it would be exciting to try this relatively new and similarly styled hotel. The website looked promising, and the prices were relatively on par with Quincy ($320 for the cheapest room without meals vs $360 at Quincy with breakfast and dinner). However we soon found out that we should have just stuck to Quincy. Service was cold and awkward, making me and my partner feel equally awkward and out of place. I had the impression that the reception staff were not very experienced. There were only 3 floors in Klapsons, with 17 rooms in total, and yet my partner and I were showed to the wrong room. The room itself was clean and tidy. No complaints here. The windows were ceiling high and looked out onto the main road which was always busy because we were in the Central Business District after all. Almost everything was in working order - except that the hair dryer was broken, there was only 1 toothbrush for 2 people, no comb, no showercap, no shaver and no hot water kettle. For the intrepid ones who are still going to brave out their stay at Klapsons - beware the shower! It takes a long time to get heated up, which means you'll be freezing in the shower cubicle waiting for warm water. The shower for the smaller rooms is also, not very helpfully, stationed in the middle of the bedroom making it quite uncomfortable on cold nights. And once the water is heated its really really hot, plus its really hard to adjust the water temp, so.. well, its really the option of getting scalded or being frozen. The espresso machine was cute though. However 6 cartridges of espresso + 6 tea bags should = at least 12 sugar packets right? 4 is simply, simply not enough! We did get full complimentary usage of the bar fridge which had some soft drinks, mineral water and beer inside. Location wise, really, there's not much nearby except office buildings.. Its not even close to any MRT station - unless you are game for a brisk 20 minute walk. We did drive though, which was a plus because we could go to Chinatown which is a 10 minute drive away, or the railway station which is also a 10 minute drive. The hotel provides free overnight parking for in-house guests. We did not patronise Lucas, the in-house restaurant. Design-wise, well, I was actually looking forward to being impressed by Klapsons - it being crafted by Sawaya & Moroni and all. However it gives me great sorrow to say that I didn't find myself impressed at all. Nothing met my expectations. Perhaps I should have invested in one of the suites? Needless to say, my partner and I will not be returning to Klapsons. We shall continue to patronise our now-favourite Quincy Hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “i'd skip it if i were you”
Reviews.Author: kylelsim
Reviews.Content: when you reach the hotel, all u see is that giant silver ball in the lobby that holds the reception desk. it looks modern and fantastic, and my expectations for the hotel went up a notch. i mean, its quite cool. but thats where everything started to go wrong. i booked the oasis suite, and had called 2 weeks before to check with their sales coordinator if it would be able to hold a small party of around 15-20 people. no problems she said, it would fit up to 30 people. so imagine my surprise when i reach the hotel to find out that to hold a party i would have to cough up $300 (non-refundable) MISC FEE just to use the room. utterly ridiculous, apparently it is to cover 'damages that the hotel may incurr' wouldnt a deposit suffice i asked, but no. MANAGEMENT RULES was all the duty manager had to say. after considering it for awhile with my partner, we paid the 300 on which they slapped on an additional 7% GST and went up to the room. the room is decent, large and quite comfortable. but once you step outside into the patio area where the jacuzzi is, well, lets just say its best to not venture out without shoes. the wooden floor was mouldy, dried leaves were everywhere, and stray hairs covered the bottom of the jacuzzi. obviously the room hadn't been opened since the last visitor left. my partner and myself spent the better part of an hour TIDYING UP AFTER THE HOTEL. in the evening, some friends brought wine over, and we searched high and low of the corkscrew, i personally went down once to ask if there was a corkscrew in the room, the receptionist insisted that there was and i went back up, but even after tossing everything out of the minibar, it was obvious that there was not corkscrew, so my friends called room service to ask them to bring up a corkscrew, room service insisted that there was a corkscrew in the room and once again, we tried searching for it. finally, we gave up and just went down to the hotel restaurant to have it opened. im tired trying to relate everything that happened, so ill just summarize everything. the patio lights were blown, so it was nearly pitch black outside, the breakfast thats included was just some random danish pastries, hard hard hard boiled eggs, toast and some odd tasting cold cuts. for the price i paid, i could have just topped up around 400 more to get the presidential suite at the St Regis. My complaints to the management took a week to reply, and all they said was hotel policy blah blah blah. boutique hotels are a good idea, but because they have no real reputation to protect, they dont care about what u think about them. for anyone who wants to patronise klapsons, my advice is to think about some other place, where you will be treated like a real guest. this was the most unfavorable experience i have ever had at a hotel in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous. A wonderful experience in every way.”
Reviews.Author: NeilInOz51
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt was full (my normal hotel) and I only got one night at the Four Seasons. So I had to go looking, and I'm very glad of that - but the Grand Hyatt has lost me for all time, I'm afraid. I've just found my favourite hotel. In the world. And I've stayed at lots. This is a delightful, funky, fun, ingenious, gorgeous hotel. The staff are gorgeous, interested, with light in their eyes and interest in everything about you. The rooms are FUNKY. But here's the key, and here's why it's not for everyone: There are only 17 rooms. Yes, a 17 room hotel in Singapore, in possibly the smallest building in the city - and it is brand new. And it is nothing like I have ever stayed in before. To the guest who gave it three stars because they served bluefin tuna: get over it, dear. To the guest who gave it one star it can only be a sick joke: "bad service just like how big and elaborated the hotel is." Right. "Big". 17 rooms. Yeah. So dear Trip Advisor - please remove that review! The hotel doesn't deserve its name to be tarnished by larrikens. So if you can handle a wonderful, modern, incredibly functional small hotel, please don't book here. Because I want a room any time I visit, and the last thing I want is for it to be booked out!

Reviews.Title: “OVER-RATED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: shmily17
Reviews.Content: worst hotel ever! bad service just like how big and elaborated the hotel is. looking for a roomful of prissy staff, please check in at klapsons!

Reviews.Title: “Serves Bluefin tuna”
Reviews.Author: stratman58
Reviews.Content: Environment conscious travellers should be aware that the hotel's restaurant (Lucas) serves 'seared bluefin tuna' on it's a la carte menu

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, fabulous people, sophisticated design and wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: Zionsingapore
Reviews.Content: Must stay! We stayed in the Oasis suite on the 24th of Dec. 2009. Perfect! Beyond expectatation!
